definitions.definition: A raised platform in a room for a high table , a seat of honour , a throne , or other dignified occupancy , such as ancestral statues ; a similar platform supporting a lectern , pulpit , etc., which may be used to speak from.
A bench , a settle , a pew .
An elevated table in a hall at which important people were seated ; a high table .
The canopy over an altar , etc.

main_definition: A raised platform in a room for a high table , a seat of honour , a throne , or other dignified occupancy , such as ancestral statues ; a similar platform supporting a lectern , pulpit , etc., which may be used to speak from. [from c. 1800.]
secondary_definitions: ( historical , northern British ) A bench , a settle , a pew .
( obsolete ) An elevated table in a hall at which important people were seated ; a high table . [13th–17th c.]
The canopy over an altar , etc.
